context: During the investigation of a suspicious access to the LSASS service, which might indicate an attempt to decrypt user passwords, several suspicious files (`hid.dll`, `winscard.dll`, `cryptdll.dll`, `vaultcli.dll`) were observed being utilized. In addition, a PowerShell command was observed being executed remotely with the following command line: `powershell.exe -noexit -command set-location -literalpath 'c:\users\bjenkins\downloads\midnight14'`. Suspicious remote activities were noted on the machine associated with multiple system and network alterations.
question: During the investigation, it was determined that an account accessed the DKM key of an ADFS object. What is the email address of the account that performed this action?
solution_steps: There was a suspicious access to the LSASS service using the process `lsass.exe`.
Suspicious remote activity was detected involving an account with SID `S-2-5-21-571436798-3864380397-1837441745-3206`.
An account with the email `gsmith@niseko.alpineskihouse.co` read the DKM key of ADFS object with ID `4cac49d3-29d3-407e-8c9b-b7ebb21541b2`.
